trans-unit.source: Provides <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> objects for each state of the **Auto Hide** button (which is displayed as a push pin) of the Explorer Bar.
This class cannot be inherited.

Each property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderPin> class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of the **Auto Hide** button of the Explorer Bar.
Gets a visual style element that represents an **Auto Hide** button (which is displayed as a push pin) in the hot state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderPin.Hot%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents an **Auto Hide** button in the hot state.
Gets a visual style element that represents an **Auto Hide** button (which is displayed as a push pin) in the normal state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderPin.Normal%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents an **Auto Hide** button in the normal state.
Gets a visual style element that represents an **Auto Hide** button (which is displayed as a push pin) in the pressed state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderPin.Pressed%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents an **Auto Hide** button in the pressed state.
Gets a visual style element that represents a selected **Auto Hide** button (which is displayed as a push pin) in the hot state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderPin.SelectedHot%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents a selected **Auto Hide** button in the hot state.
Gets a visual style element that represents a selected **Auto Hide** button (which is displayed as a push pin) in the normal state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderPin.SelectedNormal%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents a selected **Auto Hide** button in the normal state.
Gets a visual style element that represents a selected **Auto Hide** button (which is displayed as a push pin) in the pressed state.

You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ExplorerBar.HeaderPin.SelectedPressed%2A> property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement"></xref> that represents a selected **Auto Hide** button in the pressed state.
